Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into two registers: Upper - Scene of the deceased seated before an offering-table and the kneeling figure of his wife, both figures sniff lotus-flowers; two rows of Hieroglyphic text above. Lower - Central offering-table flanked by the two sons of the deceased; row of Hieroglyphic text above.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (pl.46)
